label: DXL Service Example
info:
This sample demonstrates how to register a DXL service to receive `Request`
messages and send back `Response` messages from Node-RED. The payloads in the
`Request` and `Response` messages received from the DXL fabric are printed
to the Node-RED `debug` tab.

### Prerequisites

The samples configuration step has been completed (see the
[DXL configuration sample](https://github.com/opendxl/node-red-contrib-dxl/wiki/Client-Configuration)).

### Setup

To deploy the flow, press the `Deploy` button in the upper-right corner of the
screen. If Node-RED is able to properly connect to the DXL fabric, a green dot
with the word `connected` should appear under each of the nodes which use the
DXL fabric: `Send request to DXL fabric` and
`Receive service request from DXL fabric`, and `Send response to DXL fabric`.

### Running

To exercise the flow, double-click the button on the left side of the
`Set 'ping payload for request'` node.

### Output

The following output should appear in the Node-RED `debug` tab:

~~~
"ping"
~~~

~~~
"pong"
~~~

### Details

The flow exercises the nodes below.

#### Set 'ping payload for request'

This is an `inject` input node which starts the flow. This node injects the
text "ping" as the message `payload`.

#### Send request to DXL fabric

This is a `dxl request` function node. This node connects to the DXL fabric and
sends a DXL `Request` message with the configured topic,
"/isecg/sample/mybasicservice". The request message contains the `payload` set by
the `Set 'ping payload for request'` node.
 
The `Return` field is set to "a UTF-8 string" to indicate that the payload for
the response should be set into the flow message as a UTF-8 string decoded from
the raw binary payload in the response message.

#### Receive service request from DXL fabric

This is a `dxl service` input node. This node connects to the DXL fabric and
registers a service with a `service type` of "myService". The service registers
to receive requests made to the "/isecg/sample/mybasicservice" `topic`. 

When a request is received, a message containing the `payload` from the request
is injected as a message into a new flow. The flow message also includes a copy
of the full DXL request content in the `dxlRequest` key in the message. This
is used later in the flow by a `dxl response` node to determine which request
that the response corresponds to.

The `Payload type` field is set to "a UTF-8 string" to indicate that the payload
for the request should be set into the flow message as a UTF-8 string decoded
from the raw binary payload in the request message.

#### Output payload from request

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` from the message
injected by the `Receive service request from DXL fabric` node. The output
should be the payload from the request: "ping".

#### Set 'pong' payload for response

This is a `change` function node. This node changes the `payload` field from
the message injected by the `Receive serviced request from DXL fabric` node to
"pong".

#### Send response to DXL fabric

This is a `dxl response` output node. This node connects to the DXL fabric and
sends a response for the `dxlRequest` that the node receives. The response
message contains the `payload` set by the `Set 'pong' payload for response`
node.

#### Output payload from response

This is a `debug` output node. This node outputs the `payload` from the message
injected by the `Send request to DXL fabric` node. The output should be the
payload from the response to the DXL request: "pong".

name: Receive service request from DXL fabric
